content: woodland 3 strand blanket i used an attic24 woodland yarn pack which is 15 shades of stylecraft special dk the pack is available from wool warehouse i worked uk half trebles using 3 strands of yarn held together and an 8mm hook i worked a 110 uk half treble chainless foundation to start by accident i somehow counted wrong was meant to be 100 but i couldn t be bothered to frog back when i checked a couple of rounds later  it measures approximately 130cm wide by 150cm long 100 stitches to start would make it a better proportion keep the colours shown for strand 1 as complete 100g balls and divide all of the others into 2 x 50g balls divide one of the 50g balls of copper into 2 x 25g balls i used a yarn winder and scales to divide my balls in half / quarters where required join in your next colour shown on the chart as you reach the end of that strand i have put question marks on the last 3 colours at the end because the quantities will vary depending on your gauge and variances in the yarn length on each ball even though you have divided your balls in half by weight the length may differ from ball to ball because sometimes one colour may be a bit thicker than another at the end i ended up tying the other end of my mocha ball to my first 50g of lincoln as it was running out and then just crocheted until i got as many row out of the 3 strands left as i could for the border i just worked uk double_crochet s all around the blanket using the last 25g of copper plus more of 2 of the other colours i had in my stash strand 1 strand 2 strand 3 copper 25g copper 50g storm tomato 50g blue 100g tomato 50g spice 50g spice 50g duck egg 100g gold 50g gold 50g mustard 50g mustard 50g silver 100g lime 50g lime 50g pistachio 50g pistachio 50g grey 100g meadow 50g meadow 50g cypress 50g cypress 50g mocha lincoln 50g lincoln mocha
